_header: The Pater Noster to expound may no man it praise
_description: John Audelay, Exposition of the Pater Noster — seven 11-line stanzas

BodDou302.First Lines:
The pater noster to expone may no man hit priseþat of prayers
                    is pris & most fore to prayse …
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…fore dowte of þat denLord to lyuer vs from all euolus
                    amen
BodDou302.Attributed Title: Pater noster qui es in celis (f. 33va
BodDou302.Editions:
Whiting,  Ella Keats,
                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 215-17.
